alert.note: Alert for Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 12:03AM CDT until May 05 at 10:26PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas... Fall River at Fredonia affecting Wilson County. For the Fall River...including Fredonia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fall River at Fredonia. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flood waters backup into residential yards located 1 mile south of Fredonia near the gage site off of Highway 96. Expect bank overflows on both banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:46 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning to 18.6 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning to 6.1 feet and begin rising again Saturday evening. It will rise to 6.2 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Fall River Fredonia 17.0 15.0 Wed 11 pm CD 10.0 6.2 6.2 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
